description: 'I great to see golang can doing this, but it not work correctly.

The app has the core functionality, but the UI could benefit from some design work. The login process isn't very intuitive, the interface mixes Adwaita and non-GNOME patterns in an uncanny way, and most states of the app look cluttered. The app prioritizes looking similar to the Discord desktop client over platform integration.

If you just want a simple Discord client that doesn't use Electron, this will do the trick. The performance is way better. If you want a Discord client that integrates well with GNOME and has a polished, clean UI experience, you'll quickly find out that it's outside of the scope of this app.

Definitely isn't ready to use yet due to missing features and slightly janky UI but I'll be keeping a close eye on this because it would be nice to have a discord client that integrates well with a gnome desktop.

Perfect GTK integration, but it kinda feels like that's all it is right now. Voice chat, video chat, screen-sharing all don't work. If you just use it for text, this is definitely the app for you. 

I'm on Wayland too, so I'm asking a lot out of it. If it did work, this would be the only Discord app for me!
summary: If gtkcord4 and Webcord combined, it would be the best client

description: Its a useable client as of now, but it still has a long way to go.
I'd really like to use it, but I can't when its missing core functionality such as the list of users in a discord server

Really good app if all you need - text with people. But that's it. Oh, also markdown works and adding pictures (without preview). 
4 for the attempt, hope they'll keep working on it.
A few google searches and youtube videos were insufficient to get past the login screen. Not a great start, but I love the idea of a native looking client.

Well it does use gtk4, but doesn't feel like a gnome app at all. 
Channels are too close together, there's no destinction in the message box, settings panel is a mess and would benefit from a tabbed interface, spacing is all over the place and logging in is not explained.
I installed it hoping it would integrade better with gnome, but it doesn't follow the guidelines at all.
At least all the basic functionality is there so it is promising.
Es bastante rápido a diferencia de los otros clientes de Discord que solo son la versión web pero empaquetada en Electron. Sería genial si tuviese chat de voz.
summary: Ojalá tuviese soporte para chat de voz, pero está bastante bien

description:
1. The login menu does not work logically.
2. The session keeps crashing.
3. Alas, no voice channels
summary: Interesting application, but alas, not usable yet

description:
Приложение прекрасно работает на слабом телефоне Wileyfox Swift с Linux postmarketOS.

Не хватает звонков в приложении.
